column3: I've tried to remove the warning by replacing `daemon()` with `posix_spawn()` a couple of months ago, but got lost in some problem I can really remember.\n\nIs there a motivation to remove the warning other than "just remove the warning"?
> Is there a motivation to remove the warning other than "just remove the warning"?\n\nI don't see a strategy how to follow Apples deprecation path, so yes, it's just a "remove the warning" thing.
Weak concept ACK. It seems likely that Apple will never actually remove `daemon()`, but if they do, it means nobody will have worked on a solution (since we don't see the warning anymore).

I guess if the `daemon()` function gets removed on OSX we won't detect that in a very verbose way anyways since it bypasses the `#ifdef HAVE_DECL_DAEMON` part (It will be detectable through the ./configure output).\n

utACK 12e7c558afb1ddd127229029ef0770184d786927, I don't think we have to worry about apple removing `daemon()`, POSIX compatibility is important to them.
(though it's not *officially* a POSIX function, sufficient software uses it to make it effectively one)
